column13: An outstanding meal was provided to me by 2nd Floor and their staff should be commended. I enjoyed a 50% off bottle of wine on the Sunday evening, as well as a absolutely fantastic tasting salmon and a soup that was terrific.

Still one of the best restaurants in Dallas. It is a bit noisy, but still great for a romantic special occasion. Overall the food is prepared with creativity and skill although I wasn't as "Wowed" by the food as I was when I visited a few years ago. My wife loved the lobster shooters. Overall service was good, although our waiter was a bit slow at times.
Food was excellent. Service was even better. A great place if you don't want the same experience on the Lower Greenville scene.

We took advantage of the Restaurant Week menu, which is quite a deal considering the prices on the menu. The seafood option (redfish) was not as good as other seafood I've had there, but it was good.Service was outstanding, as always....except that it took awhile to get our water when we sat down.
Fantastic evening. The service was beyond reproach. The chef hit a home run. Could not have asked for a better evening.

column4: 5840 Legacy Circle Suite D100 Plano, TX  75024
column13: The food was good but for the price I rather go to another restaurant.

We tried Asador during Restaurant Week and it turned out to be a great find. Excellent menu items with fresh and unique flavors. Our entrees were wonderful, but we were even more impressed with the salad and dessert courses. Our waiter made excellent recommendations when asked, and he went out of his way to ensure that we had a pleasant experience. We will definitely be returning to Asador.

column4: 11617 N. Central Expressway Ste 135 Dallas, TX  75243
column13: Excellent gluten free tasty options for celiacs everywhere. Fresh food, lovely seasonings and knowledgeable servers. The flour less chocolate cake was the bonus to a lovely meal.
Avanti never disappoints! Great Italian food, great service, live music nightly... Can't beat it!
Great place to hang out and have drinks after work.

column4: 8160 Park Lane Suite CX130 Dallas, TX  75231
column13: Bailey's delighted us. It's a beautiful restaurant. Wait staff was attentive but not hovering. Food was very good. They comped the one dish we didn't like; we appreciated that.We heard they are going out of business. What a shame! But, we could see why since there weren't many customers there for a Saturday night. Perhaps, it's because of the out-of-the-way location? Or, maybe the high prices (tho there are others just as high)?
Everything was top notch. Filet and lobster were perfect. They have the best fried rice too. Love this place!

The food was ok at best. This does not compare at all to other hibachi resturants I have been too. The portions are laughable. I received literally one small strip of zuchinni, and a cup of rice. Never in my life have I finished all my food at any resturant. I don't even finish all my food when I go through the drive thru, but I did at Benihana. The food was decent, I have had better. I would have considered returning if I new that I could get more than a sampling of food as my main course.

column4: 5840 Legacy Circle Suite D130 Plano, TX  75024
column13: I really enjoyed my visit. I went for my birthday and the service was great. They have an awesome Happy Hour and the location is perfect.

We went to dine over restaurant week, needless to say we were more than impressed with the ambiance and the great atmosphere all around. We were almost the last patrons to leave and not at any one time did we feel rushed. I will definitely be going back, GREAT experience!!

We made a reservation through Open Table for Bijoux - The Chef's Room. This was our first time to make a reservation there. What we didn't know is that this is separate reservation from The Bioux. When we arrived, the manager had to get involved in our discussion because they had us reserved for the Chef's Room, which is a special tasting room menu. They were able to accommodate us after a lengthy discussion. So, when making reservations there, you should be very aware of the differences. The Bjoux is a separate reservation from Bijoux - The Chef's Room. The prices vary greatly also.
THE SHRIMP IN THE SPICY SAUCE COULD BE LARGER. ALSO BREAD OR ROLLS WOULD BE NICE TO HAVE WITH THE SALAD.

column4: 8687 North Central Expressway Suite 2000 Dallas, TX  75225
column13: I love Nordstrom's Bistro N.The bar is great and the drinks are made right.The food is wonderful. I eat here just to have a great meal. Not just because I was shopping. I bring friends here to celebrate birthdays, promotions and life. The band on the weekends is an added treat.

I love sushi and the restaurants I've been going to in Chicago, I would say the sushi is just average, but at the Blue Fish, the sushi was fantastic. I visit Allen on my business trips about every quarter and I always make a point in stopping by for my favorite sushi.

column1: The Blue Fish Japanese Restaurant - Las Colinas
column4: 925 W John Carpenter Fwy Irving, TX  75039
column13: Absolutely love the Mega Lobster Roll but must share with the table. It is mega!! Had a great birthday dinner. Our waitress was fun (Yay-G - she had a fun way to say her name).

column1: The Blue Fish Japanese Restaurant-North Dallas
column13: The food has always been good. Service was much better in terms of the food coming out too fast & we did not feel nearly as rushed. Our waiter actually asked us if we were ready for the next plate. Nice job! Appreciate the change.

All of the sushi was absolutely delicious! Make sure to try the crab cake! I would pass on the chicken teriyaki, very bland and not worth the price. Don't plan on having a conversation with anyone not directly beside you. The music is loud so everyone eating talks over the music which makes it really loud!

column1: Bob's Steak & Chop House - Dallas on Lamar
column4: 555 S. Lamar Located in the Omni Dallas Hotel Dallas, TX  75202
column13: Loved the ambiance, and the great attention that our waitress provided.

column1: Bob's Steak & Chop House - Dallas on Lemmon Avenue
column13: Being in Birmingham, Alabama, there are only a few premium steak houses; Ruth's Chris, Shula's and Flemings. Even though they are small chains because they started with a great thing and expanded to a few more locations, and not truly local, they are all disappointing here in B'Ham with the exception of Flemings. I have been to Morton's, the Palm, the Chicago Chop House, Lawry's Prime Rib (prime rib is a different category), and I know there are others I haven't tried yet, but Bob's Steak and Chop House on Lemmon Ave. was just about the best I have had when I visited Dallas.
We had a wonderful dinner at Bob's to celebrate my birthday and our engagement. The service and food , as usual, we're wonderful. I would certainly recommend Bob's for any special occasion.

column4: 5760 Legacy Dr. Suite B-1 Plano, TX  75024
column13: Great food. We made reservations to celebrate our 5th anniversary. We arrived and were seated for our reservation quickly. We notice it was a little warm but didn't think much about it. By the time our dinner came we were sweating it was so unbelievably hot. We mentioned to our wonderful waitress it was hay and she said the air conditioner had been broken all day. She said it should be fixed soon. We were so uncomfortable that we were unable to enjoy the food and requested our food be packaged to go. They did give us a anniversary card and a trio of dessert sampler but it was so hot even dessert didn't taste right. I wish that we would have been told ahead of time or a manager would have apologized after we complained of the heat.

column1: Bob's Steak and Chop House - Fort Worth
column13: We celebrated 15 years of marriage. The steak was tender and could have been seasoned a little more to my taste, but was still delicious. The smash potatoes,glazed carrot,and hot bread were good as well. The barbecued stuffed quail served with spinach was very delicious.And should be a regular as one of your featured appetizers. Maybe a seasonal selection. Our waiter was attentive but could have been a little more engaging with us and the couple who was celebrating our 15th year anniversary with us. But, he did a good job overall. The hostesses were friendly upon our arrival and we were quickly seated. We had made reservations. The managers came by a couple of times to see how our dining experience was going. They too were friendly.
Overall good food, good wine, and service is excellent.

column4: 4259 Bryant Irvin Rd. Fort Worth, TX  76109
column13: This was a very nice restaurant. Not your typical items on the menu. However, one should note that this restaurant specializes in "game". Some of the things on the menu consisted of buffalo, elk and even kangaroo!!
Nice restaurant, but the food really had no flavor. We really wanted to like the place, great patio and close to home but we won't be going back

column4: 190 E. Stacy Rd Ste 1000 Allen, TX  75002
column13: Absolutely love this place. I'm so glad we have a Brazilian place in Allen. We used to have to drive to Addison every time we wanted Brazilian. Their lunch price is excellent given all you get. We try to go here at least once a month.

We had an early dinner before going to Casa Manana. We had the baby wedge which we all shared. Out waitress warned us it was large and she was correct. I had the chicken fried beef tenderloin and it was great. We didn't get to try dessert as we were all full. We'll be going back.

Very friendly service, loved walking thru the kitchen! It makes one feel as if they are getting special treatment. The food was fabulous and you get a lot of food for the buck. ! Well definitely be back.

We always enjoy Buccas. The food is always awesome especially the Apple Gorganzola Salad. The entrees are portioned for three if you get a small and for a family if you get the large. Don't miss out on great food.

We had my dad's birthday here. We made reservation for 6 but had 8 after all. They easily accommodated us. It is a great family style service we ordered one large and one small plate and had way more than enough for all 8 of us. They sang their version of happy birthday it was great.

I enjoy eating and entertaining here, food is good and it is not one those pretentious steak houses. I had my usual ribeye which was extremely rare on one end and medium well at the other. All others were OK. I was hungry and ate the whole thing.

I traveled from Louisiana to Dallas to enjoy the great entertainment and food. Lori Dawn was outstanding. I plan to visit again in the near future. It was my daughter's 33 birthday and we had an awesome time. Thanks for a wonderful evening.

We went for the Sunday Brunch. Service was good but not exceptional, table was missing sugar, sweetener, silverware. The brunch was average at best, I could have had a better lunch at Denny's and will chose it next time. We chose the buffet, nothing of note just the average fair. Biscuits, eggs, french toast, bacon & sausage etc. They did have gumbo, it was OK but Jason's Deli does a better job. Catfish nuggets, black-eyed peas (i think it was more of a mush), greens. They did have a omelet table, looked OK. The ambiance was not good, Button's really shines for dinner & Jazz which is what I will do next time we visit. All in all This was the most uninteresting Sunday Brunch I have had at what is supposed to be an upscale restaurant.

column4: 2221 East Lamar Blvd 9th Floor Arlington, TX  76006
column13: The food and service were great. They ran out of the dessert I ordered which was a disappoitment.
Excellant restaurant! The French cuisine was superb. I would recommend Cadot's Restaurant to my friends.

The food is fantastic but the service was very slow or maybe just culturally relevant!Don't go if you are in a hurry!The atmosphere is more cafe style and outdated, could use a good sprucing up...BUT, again, the food was wonderful!
Love this place! Beautiful outdoor garden complete with live music and authentic Sangria!
Interesting flavors -- mint sauce for the watermelon/tomato salad, for example -- pretty presentation, many seats look out the glass wall to the striking reflecting pool. Service was attentive.

column1: Cafe on the Green at the Four Seasons Dallas
column13: We loved our evening at Cafe on the Green! The service was impeccable and the food was outstanding. The Four Seasons and the Cafe are beautiful and the view of the hotel grounds is lovely. We will certainly be back!

There are few elegant restaurants opened for lunch on Saturdays, so to discover that Cafe Pacific fit both criteria was wonderful. Service was OK but did get better throughout our meal. Food was excellent. Cannot wait to return.

Fish tacos were small nuggets of fried fish. Almost like frozen fish sticks. Very disappointed as I was expecting healthier item. Chips and salsa are not complimentary. Unusual for a Mexican food restaurant.
Always great service, great food, divine desserts and the best Wine list!
Food was wonderful as always. Prosciutto wrapped mozzarella drizzel in 12 yr aged balsamic was to die for and steal porticini del monico was beautifully cooked. Creme brulee.to finish was perfecto.
Great food and good dining experience

column1: Cast Iron at the Omni Fort Worth
column13: My reservation was to celebrate my 30th birthday. Everyone at my tables received their correct order but me. I sent my plate back and didn't receive my correct order until 20mins later. By then all my guests had already finished eating. On top of waiting 20mins for them to correct my orde the meal wasn't worth waitin for. The meat was tough and greasy and not worth the price. For some reason we were the only patrons in the restaurant at 8pm and instead of a nice quie meal we ate to the restaurant staff moving tables and chairs and cleaning up for brunch the next day.
Food was unbelievable, and the service was first class. She was very helpful in picking out our drinks and seemed to really enjoy serving us. It was a lot of fun
chef dodds' food is exceptional and decor is nice, but the place was dead...no energy...too bad.
Although this is a fish market grill, we enjoyed an excellent filet mignon! Fabulous menu with reasonable prices!
Food was fantastic, staff was on top of things and aimed to please. Short of unlikely improvements like having a rooftop view of a tropical rainforest, this place is certainly the "cat's pajamas."
Service was friendly and prompt. The food was outstanding! Very creative and top notch flavors!
The food, service and dinner as a whole was great.
Food was above average, but wasn't the top tier gem we were looking for around this area.Service was fantastic. It was refreshing to have servers with intimate knowledge of the chefs offerings.
Naan was the best part of our meal...
I have to eat gluten-free and dairy-free. So nice that our waiter, Eric, was familiar and helpful to insure that my selections fit my needs.

Nice dark booth with adequate lighting. Outstanding service including wine service. Stuffed mushroom appetizer delicious with wonderful dipping sauce. Delicious salads, especially the apple walnut salad. Large Menu predominantly fried food and sauces with expected sides. Asked for the veal without batter, but it was very overcooked and salty. Was disappointed in the minuscule size of shrimp with the pasta Alfredo. Buttermilk bisquits to die for. Desserts looked fantastastic although we passed. Large dining room fairly empty...have never waited for a table. And the bar crowd in the next room sounded as if they were having a great time. No background music to speak of.

column1: Crossroads at House of Blues - Dallas
column13: Great service from Frank our waiter, could not ask for better. I thought mt group was the only one he was taking care off. 5% stars for Frank and his ability to keep us being his main focus. Had a great time.

Ive been to Cullpeppers before. I believe everytime I go its just as good if not betterI love to take people that have never been. They are always just as awe as I was the first time. I love love it.Anytime I want to celebrate something special I always want to go to Cullpeppers.The fountains are also so nice. I also love the open table reservation. Thank You once again
It's was so fabulous, food was to die for! Would definitely go again.
Very consistent Service. Tahn was great and he made our experience vey special.
My friends and I were here celebrating my best friends birthday. The food was great and the ambiance was fantastic. We will definitely keep this place in mind for future events.

column1: Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steak House - Dallas
column13: Very good food. Best streak I've had in a while. Service was very good, but flod took a little longer than expected.

column1: Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Ft. Worth
column13: Best steak ever. I've eaten at a lot of different steak houses in my life and this was by far the best.

column1: Del Frisco's Grille - McKinney Ave - Dallas
column13: This was a great brunch spot! Would highly recommend!

column4: 4123 Cedar Springs Road Suite 110 Dallas, TX  75219
column13: Very nice brunch, I will return.

Crowd was a bit weak, but it was a Thursday night and we were there for Bears vs. Packers instead of a normal Cowboys game. Food was really good and our servers were very attentive even with one being on her first night in training. Again it wasn't that busy and was hoping for a more festive game watching crowd, but the managers were really good about increasing the volume of the game when we asked as well as turning another screen close to us to the Rangers game.
The steak was not very hot. The blue cheese butter sauce was left off. When the waiter brought the sauce it was cold instead of heating and melted aver the steak. The food was tasty, however.
Great foodGreat serviceGreat time.

column4: 4023 Oak Lawn Ave Suite 110 Suite 11o Dallas, TX  75219
column13: We went for dinner before a play with two friends. Harmony was our wait person; she was perfect - sensitive to our time constraints but not rushing us. She had excellent suggestions among the specials and on the regular menu without at all making us feel like she was pushing us towards higher priced items. The food was excellent. The manager came by during the meal and asked how everything was going. It was not a perfunctory query; he genuinely wanted to know. He(Mike) gave us his card and said to call him if we needed anything. We tried Eddie V's during Restaurant Week and really enjoyed it. This is the first (but not the last) time we've been since then and we could not have asked for nicer experience.

Aiming for a trendy feel - but something about the use of space feels odd. It was like the restaurant has a problem meshing it's vibe with its clientele. They can't seem to keep flip flop wearing, hat and t-shirt donning people from sitting next to couples with an attempt at romance. In fact, we mentioned in our reservation on opentable that it was an anniversary dinner asking for a romantic table - they tried to sit us next to a family with very young kids in the sunny room on the north. Um - no thanks. We chose a different table - unfortunately across from a flash photo taking food blogger.
We go to El Ranchito every single week. This past week we went three times! We go for lunch and/or dinner. The food is great. The service is usually very good and the margaritas are to die for!

column4: 1501 W. Magnolia Ave Fort Worth, TX  76104
column13: Great dining experience. Interesting menu, knowledgeable servers and terrific food!
This is awesome! They the best pizza in town and a reasonably priced wine list. You can't go wrong!

column4: The Ritz-Carlton, Dallas 2121 McKinney Avenue Dallas, TX  75201
column13: I've always had exceptional meals and service here. If you've not been-go! If it's been a while since you've been-go back, the menu varies.

Our reservation was for 1pm on a Thursday and was absolutely un-needed as the place was EMPTY. It was obvious the lunch hour had past and the staff were not particularly thrilled to provide service. They were much more interested in resetting the tables for their evening customers. The food was most likely the leftovers from the lunch hour and lacked any taste. Service was non-existant. I don't see this restaurant staying open for very long. Bad food, bad service, bad attitude.

It took almost 3 hours to finish the meal. The service was slow. Our waiter was MIA for long periods. The staff seemed to hate their jobs and definitely didnt want to to be there. The food was average at best and definitely not worth those prices. The tables were way to small and so close together I was practically rubbing elbows with the people around me. This was our anniversery dinner and I wish we would have gone somewhere else. I will never eat there again.
PLEASE PUT CANNOLI BACK ON THE DESSERT LIST, WE ALWAYS ENJOR EATING AT FEERES.

We are DFW locals and went into Dallas to celebrate our 10 year wedding anniversary. We wanted a romantic and rememberable night out. We got that and way beyond. Everything from the atmosphere, food, drinks, service - it was all exquisite! Thank you for living up to our expectations! We will be back!
Best filet EVER. Well worth the drive from Dallas!

column4: The Adolphus Hotel 1321 Commerce St. Dallas, TX  75202
column13: The best resturant on earth hands down.

column1: Gordon Biersch Brewery Restaurant - Park Lane
column13: I really enjoyed the California Cobb Flatbread. It eas very flavorful.

column4: 7401 Lone Star Drive, Suite B120 Plano, TX  75024
column13: I love the hummus salad. Service was a bit spotty on the patio.
The food was outstanding and the service was great. The waiter was very knowledgable about the menu and the wine. I would highly recommend this restaurant!

column4: 2337 South International Parkway at DFW Airport, Terminal D Dallas, TX  75261
column13: I went to the Grand Met for my wife's birthday dinner and had a great time. No trouble with the parking and the food was really special. They've got a way at Grand Met - the chefs do, of infusing a lot of different flavors into each dish. My filet was perfect and the sea bass was really good because they had a lentel sause over it that made the dish work so well....Go to the Grand Met. I think you'll really like it....

My wife and I met on grad school at SMU, and we ate dinner at The Grape the night before we went to Florida to get married; this was our first visit to The Grape in 25 years, and the mushroom soup was just as delicious. I had the smoked tenderloin, which is now my last meal, should the need ever arise. My wife had a chicken and pasta dish that was made to her specifications, and our server was friendly and discrete.

column4: 3309 N. Central Expwy. Ste. 370 Plano, TX  75023
column13: The food was excellent and the service outstanding. Our first experience with Greek faire and it was delicious. We' plan to go back!

column1: The Grill on the Alley - Dallas
column13: Very nice place. Food good and not noisy so you can talk .

column4: 2300 Highland Village Rd Ste 500 Highland Village, TX  75077
column13: Our first visit to the Grotto will surely NOT be our last! Service was great, food...FANTASTIC! Very nice mixture of menu offerings. Definitely satisfied all our divergent palates. We'll be back!

column1: H3 Ranch at the Stockyards Hotel
column4: 109 East Exchange Ave. Fort Worth, TX  76164
column13: Great steaks and an excellent old west atmosphere. A great place to eat when visiting the Stockyards.

My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our dining experience at Hannah's. The service and food was exceedingly superb. Hannah's staff went above and beyond helping us celebrate my wife's new job; they had made a special notation of our celebration and warmly congratulated her upon our entering the restaurant and again when our server first greeted us. Our meal was not rushed, but each delectable course was served timely and we were given ample time to enjoy our selection completely. We highly recommend Hannah's for every occasion!

This was our second time in a year dining at Hibashi, I could not remember why we had not been back, until we walked in. the restaurant is always near empty, but staff seems plentiful. with this said, getting served was like pulling teeth. one server sat us, then dissapeared, another took our drink order which took forever. finally the first server took out sushi order and that took forever to get as well.the sushi is not great and doesn't seem very fresh. but the service is the worst part.now that I remember, we won't be back
One of my favorite places in Dallas. It has actually gotten better over the years.
What a treat! We looked late for a Saturday night reservation and found the new Howard Wang's. The appetizers were amazing, even the tofu! The cucumber salad was refreshing!
We were very surprised by the lack of attentiveness by our waitress. Defintely not what we expected from our prior dining at III Forks.
The mango flambe is a must.

column4: 1279 Legacy Dr. Suite 100 Frisco / Plano, TX  75034
column13: I guess I would say my experience was overall disappointing and incomplete. The food was as promised very good. After that not so. I am not sure the point of letting it be known that we were celebrating a special occasion when everyone at the restaurant was oblivious to the fact. The whole dinning room was occupied by a huge wedding reception, leaving only the bar area for the other patrons. There was however a private dinning area that was being used for other diners but all times during our stay always had 2 to 4 empty tables. Of course the answer we got when we inquired is that they were reserved. We had a reservation also we got the special occasion table int the middle of the bar and next to the main entrance
I felt the seating was inadequate and the food was just okay. I think it should have been better for the price.

column4: 7161 Bishop Rd. Suite G-1 Plano, TX  75024
column13: We went on a Sunday night so it was pretty quiet. Had a fun waiter which is always good. Friends with us ordered the corn side which wasn't what they expected--it was taken off the bill without our even asking.
Fine dining at it's best. food and service were both supurb and of high standards. Loud near bar so sit farther away.

column4: 301 E. Las Colinas Blvd Suite 301 Irving, TX  75039
column13: This was our 2nd visit to Jinbeh and we recommend this restaurant as a great place for sushi and teppanyaki. The chef this visit didn't season the food enough but it was still a great experience...we love that the chefs just cook and don't need to add all the banging of knives or throwing of rice.

Food was great but they seemed to be understaffed on the wait staff. Food didn't take long to come out once ordered but it was difficult to get our waitress to help us. She would disappear for long periods of time making it hard to order, ask for needs and get the bill.

Kenichi truly is one of the best places for sushi in Dallas. While their prices may be a bit high, the quality and creativity of the food is incredible. The service is friendly and helpful - more than happy to guide you through the impressive menu. We enjoyed a great date night at Kenichi and look forward to going back.

column4: 5100 Belt Line Rd Ste 764 Dallas, TX  75254
column13: The service was over the top. The food -- best in Dallas!!

column4: 5000 S Beltline Rd Suite 775 Dallas, TX  75254
column13: Truly outstanding service. As fine as any where in the country. Seriously.Only better service I have had is at The French Laundry.Filet with Crabcake was outstanding.Kenny's is a gem. We will be back. Only dish that was not perfect was the creme brulee. Slightly too soft custard and a little over toasted on the brown suger.
I took my Granddaughter to Kirby's for her 13th Birthday. Staff was excellent. It was a night she will never forget. Everything was perfect and the wait staff were excellent.

First time to dine there. We had a coupon, so otherwise would not have thought to eat there. The menu was not the type of food we would normally be interested in. One other table was occupied when we arrived, but for most of the meal we were the only ones in the entire restaurant.

The overall experience was wonderful, however the lettuce on the side salads was old. they should consider using romaine or a mixed green salad. Iceberg lettuce really doesn't fit with the quality of the entree dishes.
The drinks are amazing! It is worth going just for them!

column4: 8687 North Central Expressway North Park Center Dallas, TX  75225
column13: Was great for a small last minute get together. Everyone enjoyed and commented how good the food was. It is right in the mall so a little loud but was fine for our needs. Well worth a visit if you are nearby or at the mall.
A perfect evening and a really nice experience with a couple that had never been to La Calle Doce before. Great night!

Our waitress did not have a good command of English so we ended up with drinks that we did not intend. The food was not particularly tasty or well seasoned. For example, the chicken tacos consisted of shredded chicken in a folded and deep fried tortilla, period. Of course, the three tacos were smothered with shaved lettuce and shredded cheese.Tortilla soup lacked the smooth consistency that makes it special. Instead, we received a broth like soup with lots of fried tortilla strips on top.

Quaint place, great service, food-very good but expensive for what you get. Seafood stew $29, not much seafood for price but very good. Halibut w/lobster risotto very good(didn't see price-I'm sure it was pricey). Veal milanese was good but $39(could've been chicken & I wouldn't have known the difference.(Cheesecake factory used to have a chicken breast that was basically the same thing on their menu)Pounded very thin & huge(def a split if you're a woman-wish we would've been told this). Salty arugula, tomato salad which was good with veal but too salty without.(&I love salt) Veal actually lacked flavor. Wish I would've tried the scallops entree. Staff very attentive. Will not return-Will go to Taverna.Too many other rest. options for $$$$

column1: Landmark Restaurant - The Warwick Melrose Hotel Dallas
column13: A wonderful dining experince: romantic, elegant, highly professional and informative wait staff, beautiful view, and incredible food. The new chef and menu are innovative and outstanding.
Outstanding, as it has been on all previous visits.

The noise level was just awful. As a person who had dined there several times in past years but not in a while, I was unable to figure out what had changed. This was a table of 5 friends celebrating a birthday of one member of the party. We could not hear one another across the table after the restaurant filled. Loved the food!
Great meal with excellent service - consistent high quality dining

My wife and I have been coming here for 15+ years and just recently started bringing our kids. The food has never disappointed, the waitstaff is excellent and we are always well taken care of. The King Crab legs are always awesome and the Lobster Bisque is the best I have ever tasted. The sides are simple but steamed to perfection every time! We plan to be back often!
It was our first visit to Local. Waiter was friendly and helpful. The food was perfect. Would go back. Thanks.

column1: The Loft at NYLO Plano at Legacy
column13: Although their menu is pretty limited, "Hotel Restaurant", their Bar, Social and Outdoor areas where outstanding. The dinning area is not very expansive so seating is pretty limited. However they do have picnic style benches outside where you can also eat, which was a wierd combo. Their design and decorations are pretty modern and trendy yet they have certain things, like the picnic tables which they use to try and cater to families. The bar is really cool and well stocked. Their inside social area is pretty clever and inviting and their outdoor pool, patio, performance area is outstanding. Of course the live music also helps.
The valets were required to wear black pants in 100 degree weather. Black or khaki shorts would not detract from the experience.

column4: 4700 Camp Bowie Blvd Fort Worth, TX  76107
column13: Service was horrible....poor waiter didnt seem to know what to do.

They take reservations, however one was not needed on the Tuesday evening we went.I love the craftsman look of the place with the exposed beams and hardwood in the main dining room.Spicy chicken pasta was yummy for me and my wife enjoyed her chicken dish as well. Service was timely and friendly - boxing leftovers with a smile.

Got in early so there was no wait. Seating was as requested consodering the restaurant interior is fairly noisy everywhere. Location is out of the way so there is no view to enjoy. Seating and wait staff were efficient. Food - fresh catch of the day - was overcooked.
Service was great. The fact that the server already knew we were celebrating a birthday was Great!
As close to NYC as you can get in Texas.Good food, good service and a good vibe.Great looking crowd with a dress to impress birthday party on a Sat night.Whats not to like.

Medium-rare rib-eye steak was well prepared but a with a little more gristle than preferred. Sides are amazing; jalapeno girts and sweet corn polenta are always a favorite. Maguire's is one of our favorite places for dinner.

column1: The Mansion Restaurant at Rosewood Mansion on Turtle Creek
column13: We had an amazing dinner for my husband's birthday. Perfect in every way!!

ur group of 5 were visiting Dallas and dined at Manuel's this week, and we all were beyond pleased with every aspect of our experience. Brent, our server, was delightful - knowledgeable about the menu and friendly but not intrusive. 4 of us ordered the tasting menu - something I'd never tried anywhere before.While the portions were modest and not Texas-sized, every bite was a beautifully presented taste adventure! And none of us left hungry. A special treat was the amuse bouche - a shrimp in a shot glass with a delicate coconut sauce. Our 5th ordered a shrimp pasta dish which he raved about.I hope Dallas foodies will make a special effort to dine here soon!

Last weekend was the first time that we tried Marquee Grill and we're sad that we hadn't been there before since they've been open for 17-months now. The service was wonderful, our waiter and the General Manager were both so attentive. We started with the duck spring rolls and they were amazing. I had the shrimp and grits, which were the best I've ever had. My husband had the 12 oz. bone in pork chop, which was a great. If you haven't been already you need to try this restaurant!

Try the tamarind margarita it is amazing! We choose to eat here just for the tamarind margarita! They have a great separate margarita bar if you just plan to have drinks. We love the guacamole made table side just the way we want! Love this place. One of our favorites places to eat.
The noise level was much higher than our previous visit which was also on a Sat nite
Took associates and clients for a casual dinner and everyone was impressed. Really enjoyed our evening .. the food, the wine and the service. Sam, the owner, is a great host.

column4: 4000 Five Points Blvd., Suite 119 Arlington, TX  76018
column13: This was our first time going and we will never forget this place because this is the place where I porpose to my lady and she said yes. This place will forever be in my heart thanks again Dave couldn't have asked for a better time
Agressively priced, slowly delivered and average fair. Dinner was disappointing when compared to previous luncheon dining.

I loved the quiet, street side table for four. We were especially impressed that our servers were very knowledgeable about the menu and were more than willing to explain and recommend items. We enjoyed great drinks from the bar and tasty appetizers! Our waiter was very courteous and promptly took our orders. Everything was delivered as ordered! We had a very enjoyable evening with the best of dining. I would recommend to anyone as a special occasion since it is a bit pricey....but worth it!

column4: 5100 Belt Line Rd Suite #544 Dallas, TX  75254
column13: The food was delicious and the price was less than what we've paid at other 4 star restaurants. We had 2 appetizers, 2 entrees, a bottle of wine, coffee and dessert for around $112.00. We usually pay around $160.00 at another restaurant we frequent. We will definitely go back.
The chef/owner personally came by our table to chat and check on us--very personable service and great dining experience!
Budin Azteca folks. It is an otherworldly experience.

Good food. But it was Labor day weekend (Sunday night) and our server said they had a lot of staff call-ins so they were short-handed SO the service was inattentive for the $ you pay for this type of restaurant. We ended up having to retrieve our drinks from the bar because no one to serve us. We had late reservations, but hostesses were still dazed and confused. One actually pointed to our table to go ahead and head over there. I hurried to the table before my wife had a chance to "reply". But stuff likes this can happen, so we'll try again on a non-holiday weekend and give it a another shot. It is a neighborhood restaurant.
Gave this place a second chance after a bad experience a year ago.
Michael's has been very good for a long time and it's still a great choice - excellent food at a reasonable price.

column1: Mignon - Prime Steaks, Seafood and Cocktails
column13: Delicious food. Only strange thing was that OpenTable showed no 6:30 reservations yet when we arrived at 7pm the restaurant was mostly empty.

This was my first visit to The Mint and after reading the positive reviews, I was disappointed in my $25 lunch as was my dining companion. Service was fine but our server didn't utter a word to us other than, "Something to drink?" I had the salmon in curry which was fine but for $20, I expected more. Great location and atmosphere/design is excellent. The place was packed. Maybe I just ordered the wrong thing....would give it another try.
Everything we order is so flavorable!This has become our favorite restsutant for fine dining at affordable prices.
Wonderful, original Italian food. Great alternative to chains. Reasonably priced. Terrific food.

The online menu was not the same as the restaurant menu, which made it difficult to order for persons with dietary restrictions. A simple wheat spaghetti with marinara sauce came out with fetticini noodles instead of spaghetti noodles with a sauce less than flavorable, more like tomatoes with no seasoning. The waitress did not know the menu and was less than helpful. Her only answers were "I don't know". On a positive note, the other meals seemed to be satisfying to the rest of the group.
Monica's lasagna rules! Different vibe from Deep Ellum restaurant, but still unique with wonderful food.

Very impressed with the hostess...she was busy when we left but came after us when we were already out the door and thanked us for coming. Have not had this kind of customer services in quite some time! Would definitely come back for the service and to try other menu items. So glad we tried this restaurant!

Morton's Dallas is no longer the "speak easy" of steak houses. Loud, energetic music in a modern, pop environment will appeal to many, but don't expect the previous quite elegance. Gone is the food presentation and there's a definite up sell to order certain desserts early. Overall, though, the food was good and service excellent. A party room is adjacent the dining room and the revelers speeches, laughter and applause spill into the dining room making for a general party-like atmosphere for everyone.

column4: 2334 North International Parkway Terminal C DFW Airport, TX  75261
column13: Wow - what a disappointment. Had dinner with 3 business colleagues. Maitr'd was really friendly as was wine sommelier. However, the food was almost 100% disappointing. Absolutely nothing noticeable about anything (except the lamb chops - which were average). Steak was almost not edible - no flavor and seemed soft and mushy - odd for what is billed as a top end Dallas restaurant. Fish was also tasteless and soggy. Plus, air conditioning system was broken - and stuck on very cold. Maitr'd came back a few times to apoligize and offered tablecloths to the women to put over their shoulders - which they actually used because it really was freezing. Didn't even stay for coffee or dessert - couldn't wait to leave the fridge and lousy food.
Compared to other sushi resturants, it's more expensive and not the same quality.

This was our first visit to Naan. We found the food to be very good beginning with the dumplings and going on to the sushi and Teriyaki Chicken. Some areas of the restaurant were still under construction with plywood bar tops, but we sat in the dining area without distraction. Our server, Levon, was courteous and patient, and we were in early for dinner, leaving us little competition for his attention.

column1: Next Wood Fired Bistro & Vino Bar
column13: The service and food was outstanding. We all enjoyed our dinner very much.
This venue screams excellance! In a city full of big hats,big elbows and brontosaurus steaks- N & S is simply the best! Lobster Mac a must...can't wait to go back. NUFF SAID!!!

column4: 5800 Legacy Drive, Suite C1 Plano, TX  75024
column13: Is a perfect place to eat and have fun.

column4: Hotel Crescent Court, 400 Crescent Court Dallas, TX  75201
column13: We have been to Nobu several times and each time has been a great experience. We asked our waiter for suggestions and we were not disappointed! The food was delicious and the servers were attentive and friendly. Will definitely dine there again soon!
Loved our dining experience. Second time to Nosh and will go back the next time we are in Dallas.

column4: 1628 Oak Lawn Avenue, Suite 110 Suite 110 Dallas, TX  75207
column13: Everything was perfect. Each dish brought to the table was a delightful experience. The cocktails and recommended wine were excellent. Wonderful atmosphere with comfortable seating. Very nice background music (I would love to have a copy of the track)that was at a perfect volume so we were able to talk in a normal tone of voice, yet at the same time it felt very private. The service was attentive yet unobtrusive. We had 4 courses including dessert, with cocktails, wine, and coffee and it was about $100 per person, and well worth it.
Lobster bisque was outstanding!
Staff went above and beyond their responsibilities to do a great job----like finding a missing cell phone and returning it the next day. Great food, great service.

looked forward to dining at old Warsaw but no reservations were open till after 8:30 and when arrived the resturant was empty except for two other couples also open table offered me 1000 point for the reservation but only gave me 100 and that was the second time that had happened. Next time i will choose a resturant that I really wanted to dine at as there are so mant great ones in uptown

column4: 770 Road to Sixflags Drive St. 100 Arlington, TX  76011
column13: One of our favorite neighborhood dining spots. We visit at least once a month and always enjoy the cuisine and the service.

It is nice to go into a restaurant and have any one of the servers passing your table pick up empty dishes, fill drinks, and check how things are going. Been here three times now and the food has always been excellent.
I do not have any criticism for The Palm Restaurant in Dallas, TX. We were warmly greeted at the door by the Hostess, and our waiter was great. As usual, the food was excellent.

Food was very good. I had not been to this restaurant in a few years. I would say it is better than I remembered. There is an option to sit out on the patio, which I would recommend. The service was good. We were able to enjoy our appetizer and dinner without feeling rushed.

Of all the steak places in Dallas this is THE best. Never a bad meal at Pappas, ever. The best wine list and by far the best creme brulee anywhere. My husband and I love Papas. Its consistency is amazing.

column4: 8166 Park Lane Suite C310 Dallas, TX  75231
column13: food was actually very good. I had the Salmon and my wife had the beer can chicken. Both were very tasty and well presented.

Food was really good. Good selection although surprised menu was missing classics like chicken parm. Otherwise no complaints. It was a slow Thursday night only a few tables. Music was pretty loud considering how empty the restaurant was. It was borderline obnoxious. Beautiful interior. Our server was new. Her second night so she was a little off but very nice and it wasn't an issue. We'll be back!
My first lunch was lovely. Can't wait to try brunch.
Service was very attentive, food was very good. We were a little concerned with the location in a strip mall, but turned out fine.
Love the tomato artichoke bisque! And the interior design is so much better than their previous location.
I have been to this Posado's on several occasions. This time the service was horrible. I will go one more time to this Posado's and if the service is bad again, I will not go back.

A colleague recommended this spot for a brunch I had with an out of town guest. I've lived in Dallas 8 years and had never been here. It was very relaxing and perfect for Spring and Summer weather. Next time I'm bringing my bathing suit! EXCELLENT service and atmosphere.
First time; great patio; the waitress was very helpful and recommended some very good choices. Prices are reasonable; very nice place to go.

A friend and I met for a drink and dinner and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The wine and food were just great. It was a little loud and the service a little slow, but that may have been because they were very busy. Good for them on a Thursday night!!
I loved it and the chef was very down to Earth and approachable

It was our 21st Anniversary and my wife wanted something special and she felt she got it.I can't Say I found any big things that stood out that turned me off. My wife can't stop thanking me for the wonderful time. The waiter was on top of it, right down to the free dessert. Great experience.
Being from NY and having many options for food, I actually liked the restaurant and enjoyed my night. I definetly will be going back when my family visits.

column1: The Ranch at Las Colinas fka Cadillac Ranch Restaurant
column4: 857 West John W Carpenter Freeway Irving, TX  75039
column13: Went there for wedding anniversary. Wasn't too upscale. Down to earth, with western motiff. Ordered the chicken fried steak. Was somewhat dissapointed. It was cut so thin, that I thought I was eating nothing but the breading. Had french fries instead of the offered mashed potatoes. Mistake. French fries were over-cooked and hard to eat. Wife had the prime rib.....excellent!!!!! She shared. Should have went with her idea. Would still go back, but would go with the prime rib.
Very quiet and intimate. This is a restaurant where the chef really cares about your experience

This was our first try at Blue Plate. We have loved all of Rathbun's other restaurants so thought we'd give this one a try too. It was good. Not great, just good. But our server, Tim, was awesome and friendly and really made the evening great. We may try it again at some point, but there are so many other choices in that area that we'll probably try first.
Food was great, waiter excellent, food runner was crazed. Noise level : too loud.
We greatly enjoy Remington's and go there often. It is a great seafood restaurant and the prices are very reasonable.
Excellent. Ricky was one of the best waitpeople we've ever had. Acted liked he loved his job

column4: 1701 N. Market Street In the West End Dallas, TX  75202
column13: Pleasant evening. Food was varied - half loved their choices, half were just so-so but I think it was a matter of preference and not that the food wasn't prepared well. Waitstaff was slow in the beginning but apparently got it together and were attentive after the initial delay.We had a good time...which is what matters at checkout.

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - Ft. Worth
column13: Excellant. Great for expense account dinner as it was quite pricey. The steak did indeed melt in your mouth.

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - North Dallas
column13: They lived up to their reputation and it was everything we expected and more. Fabulous food and exceptional service. Lauren could not have done anything more to make our experience perfect.
Couldn't have been more satisfied with the food or service. Will be sure to patronize the restaurant again in the future.
Perfect as always - it is joy as are Abraham, Christy and all the staff!

We found this restaurant through Open Table, and were extremely pleased that we did. It is a small venue in the older part of Arlington, and is immaculately kept up. We arrived a little early to have a drink at the bar, and the service was outstanding, and thew drinks were VERY large for the price. The food was exceptional. and the service was very personalized. If we lived in the area, we would return many times. Please try this restaurant. You will not be disappointed.

column4: 7300 Lone Star Drive, Suite C100 Plano, TX  75024
column13: awesome ambiance, fantastic service, wonderful food!

column4: Hilton Anatole 2201 Stemmons Freeway Dallas, TX  75207
column13: Nana was a little more 'old school' than we expected, but it seems that's about to change. We actually caught their current set up on it's last night. I actually enjoyed the smartly dressed staff and the lovely place settings. I thought the food was good, though it ranged from just 'good' with a couple of stand outs. We're definitely interested in checking it out after the remodel to see how the experience differs.
Great business lunch location
Very loud place. Good if you like to scream.
We sat on the patio and enjoyed the weather, great food and good service.
Excellent menu and food quality. The pressed sushi is a must!

column4: 1651 S. University Dr. Fort Worth, TX  76107
column13: Need a sauce on teh sea bass- $37 for a "hunk of fish" is way too expensive and way to boring. Was quite disappointed.
I continue to be impressed with dining at the Silver Fox. The food is outstanding, and wonderfully tasteful.
Excellent food, excellent service!

Took our son here for his 16th birthday. Food came out hot and well prepared for all steaks from filet to new york strip. The wait staff is incredible and will take care of every request promptly. We also had the creamed corn and sauteed spinach, both good. We have been here several times and plan on returning.

column4: 111 West 4th Street Suite 15 Ft. Worth, TX  76102
column13: We had a blast and our waitress was hilarious. She definitely made the experience even more enjoyable for us.

Ambience-wise, there's a lovely lanai and a parlour room...both something a little different especially in this neighborhood. Conversely, there's a enormous tv as the centerpiece of the bar, which seems inappropriate for the concept.Attentive servers and reasonable food times...prepare for a long wait from the bar. I arrived prior to my dinner companion, and sat at the bar. It was early...just after 5pm, so not crowded as yet. No one acknowledged me or took a drink order. Once we made it to our table, drinks took 20 minutes to arrive.The food is highly overrated. The beet salad and the slaw were both well done. Crab cakes, fried chicken, and the fish feature were mediocre at best.

On a friday night, the restaurant was only a quarter full. Our server was very good, attentive, brought out the food as it became ready. The quality of the food was average including kobe meatballs, fish tacos and chicken tagine. The fried brussel sprouts were really delicious. I don't think this restaurant will last...
The Standard Pour has it all: Great ambiance , tasty food ( love the fried chicken), outstanding service, wonderful drink many and a great hang out spot.

Steel has a great selection and range of fusion food - from curries to sushi to steak - it is nice to be able to move from one to another to another and still get very good versions of each. So many restaurants try to be "a jack of all trades" (foods) and end up being "masters of none" - Steel provide excellent dishes, whether you select sushi, steak, curry or any combination...
normally outstanding in everyway. This lunch was inundated with salt that would take your breath away.

column1: Steve Fields Steak and Lobster Lounge
column13: Service was great, buy food quality wasn't up to par with the price.

They changed up their menu...it's no considerably smaller then before and many of their "specialty" rolls are fried are filled with spicy mayo. The fish quality was good...the place wasn't crowded and our server was attentive. If they could get their rolls to be a bit "healthier" and skip the frying and mayo, I'd be much happier.

column4: 1420 E. Southlake Blvd Suite 168 Southlake, TX  76092
column13: Good food, but slightly on the pricey side.

We had been told the food was fabulous and it was good however I thought the $25 corking fee was outrageous and thought the size of the portions was small. They put us at the table right next to the door when there was clearly only 4 tables full of people the whole night and made us feel that we were an after thought and that we were really not wanted there.

Limited menu, but understand they are going through a change from Bolla to T/X. Service was good. Great restaurant for private conversation. Thank you for a beautiful night. Love the patio off of the bar too.

column1: Technique at Le Cordon Bleu - Dallas
column4: 11830 Webb chapel Road Suite 1200 Dallas, TX  75234
column13: A very nice place to have lunch but one needs to be patient. The staff are students and therefore are learning the craft. However, all in all a very enjoyable experience.
The omakase was overpriced and not impressive at all. Very basic Japanese food, nothing innovative or special, unless you consider shu Mai and tempura to be fine dining.
very good waitstaff. our waiter was there when we needed him and the food was superb. would visit there again sooner rather than later!
The food was great. The service was not so great, but they made up for it with a free dessert. The appetizer and main entree was wrong.

The food was very delicious. I had the smoked pork ribs and they were finger licking good. We took my mom there for her birthday and the only complaint I could make was the loud music that kept us from being able to hear one another. I think we should have sat on the patio. The waiter was ok, but seemed to give other tables more attention. I would go there again. It's a little pricey, but a nice treat for a special birthday.

Our second attempt at eating at Tillman's-the first time (just before a TCU event), we were told that the wait was 45 minutes. After sitting at the bar 45 minutes, when we asked how much longer, we were told it would still be 45 minutes. So, we left rustrated, but we decided to give it another shot since we thought the crowd must speak well of the food quality.This time, we made reservations quite a bit later in the evening for parents' weekend at TCU. Our server had to apologize several times for the very long wait, but he didn't seem overly stressed about it. The appetizers and drinks were fairly quick, but we waited way too long for entrees. I saw no evidence of management doing any type of "damage control".

Quite simply put, there isn't a review out there that can do this wonderfully simplistic restaurant justice. As is always the case, we had an exceptional experience. My girlfriend and I have had the pleasure of dining here more times than I can count (at least on my fingers and toes), and our usual order rarely deviates. To start, try the pork belly and tuna tower, both are excellent and full of flavor. For non-sushi fans, you can never go wrong with the chicken teriyaki or pork katsu bowls, and the fish n' chips is also not to miss. However, most venture here for the sushi, and my advice is as follows: lobster roll, beef takaki roll, pretty woman roll, blackened white tuna nigiri, and sea bream nigiri. Take my advice, and thank the chefs!

We arrived for our 8:30 reservation and was promptly seated. That's when the night got off to a horrible start. We didn't see any servers for the next 30 min. We finally stopped the bartender (Priscilla) and requested a manager. She immediately took our orders and made up for the previous lack of service. The cocktails we selected were great and the food was awesome. The night started out a bit bumpy but improved as the night went on.

column4: 221 Las Colinas Blvd East Irving, TX  75039
column13: Fantastic true Italian restaurant. In the heart of Texas. Go here. You will love it.

Triniti at Tower Club is quite a gem. Atop Thanksgiving Tower, it offers one of the best views of downtown Dallas- right in the heart of the city. This was a perfect location for for a romantic evening, offering a sense of seclusion even in the midst of many other patrons. The food was excellent, enjoying the free-range antelope and my date savored the Halibut. Both were very well done.
All the food is fresh and made to orderWine list is quite good with outstanding pricesStaff was friendly and efficient.

column1: Truluck's Seafood, Steak and Crab House - Addison
column13: Overall very nice mix of food and service. Wine list is also very above average

column1: Truluck's Seafood, Steak and Crab House - Dallas Uptown
column13: Ordering mixed drinks, our server seemed put off that we did not order wine. Not sure if intended to be, but servicing the table was a tad slow with the table maintenance.

column1: Truluck's Seafood, Steak and Crab House - Southlake
column13: Our server was particularly fine and spent time telling us about her move and subsequent living situation and schools in the area. She happens to live in Keller and we were able to have a fine discussion about schools in Keller and Flower Mound as we live there. The food was very good. I would have chosen a steak instead of the shrimp that I ordered. The shrimp was rather ordinary. My husband ordered the salmon and our daughter had crab legs and both were excellent. The lobster bisque soup was wonderful! We waited a bit for our entrees but this was fine for us as we had more time to let the food digest. I would recommend this restaurant to friends.
Alway go every time we are in Dallas . Great food and service!
There weren't many people there for dinner, but the food was very good. I had no problems with making a substitution on my meal.

This place had a great environment, the service was exceptional and the food was great. My husband didn't like the chicken waffles at all but my benedict was the best I have ever had! Wish I wasn't pregnant so I could have enjoyed the bottomless mimosas and bellinis! :)-- I highly recommend this place for breakfast, brunch, lunch & dinner!

We were very pleasantly surprised with our first visit here, after seeing mixed reviews online about the restaurant. For DFW, having an outdoor patio is hard to find so I'd say it is nice. When we arrived for our reservation they were very kind, the manager was up front and greeted us, and we decided to go up to the bar since we were early. They have some fun cocktail selections and appetizers that we tried. Then for dinner, the ambiance is really nice downstairs (modern hip which is hard to find in Grapevine) and the service was great. The garlic bread was reallyyy yummy and we had a nice steak. Only complaint was the cheese used in the mac and cheese side wasn't our favorite, but that's personal taste. Overall, great experience!

My husband and I love this restaurant! It truly is amazing! The Chilean Sea bass is outstanding. It will melt in your mouth. My husband has tried the cowboy ribeye and the buffalo ribeye. He loves them both. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Enjoy!

I had the spinach & black bean enchiladas with Salsa Verde and my wife had a couple of the Taqueria tacos. The enchiladas were so well presented, had great color and texture, and were very flavorful. The tacos come wrapped in two corn tortillas so you can actually make two tacos out of each one (they're on the small side so it works out really well).The service was great, the food was great, loved our table by the window looking out to the street, frozen margaritas with chili powder infused salt on the rim were awesome, and the topper was the miniature sopapillas served with cinammon honey, chocolate, and caramel to add just the right amount of sweet to end a great meal. Well done Wild Salsa!
Food was perfect, along with what is probably the best scenic views in all of North Texas! Truly a special place.
This was our second time at Winewood. It was just as great as the first. The food is fresh and delicious. We're going to make this a regular go-to spot.
A classic! Always a great experience!

This restaurant was absolutely fabulous. The menu was so unique, and we loved each dish we ordered. The humus was outstanding, and the great food was accompanied by a knowledgable, friendly, and very helpful waiter. We will definitely be returning to this restaurant for a great atmosphere and even better food with competetive prices.
The food and service was excellent. The ambiance was a little casual but was fitting for being in Dallas.

column4: 4757 West Park Boulevard Suite 108 Plano, TX  75093
column13: Great modern atmosphere paired with very authentic Shanghainese style Chinese food. Owner is a local boy done good, calling upon his roots to present an amazing style of food that strays away from the typical American take on Chinese food.

column1: Yellow Rose Steak and Chop House
column4: 890 Parker Square Dr Flower Mound, TX  75028
column13: I was expecting a more intimate venue based on the size of the building, pictures online, and largely more exspensive menu. I have been in a Saltgrass steakhouse and had a more quiet evening and paid less for a better meal. I will not return.
Definitely ba good neighborhood find. Usually can get in on short notice. Sometimes I like to eat in the bar and watch a game. Easy place to stop in when you have no plans. Reliably good.
Always a great dinner with fabulous service.
I felt like the waitress was rushing us, even though it was not very busy. We were there for a birthday celebration and were enjoying our company.

The manager was very friendly and I showed him my coupon for a free bottle of wine. We had been to another location on Preston and had enjoyed their restaurant. I ordered the lamb gyros which were very good. The appetizer combo platter with hummus and other dips with pita bread was the best. My greek salad the dressing wasn't typical Greek. But it was still good. The wine was great and enjoyed the quiet atmosphere, got their early at 6:30 and it seemed like people eat out later so it wasn't crowded at all. I would recommend this restaurant. While I was waiting at the bar for a friend, I wasn't asked to get a drink while I was waiting and I didn't see any staff behind the bar. I waited about 15 mins and would have ordered a drink.

column1: Zodiac at Neiman Marcus – Downtown Dallas
column13: Always a classic. We picked up our weekend guests at DFW airport and drove to the Zodiac Room for lunch.
